snippet: Editors and members of Congress fear that the cost-cutting action could lead to interference by the officials that Stars and Stripes reports on.
abstract: Decision to move military newspaper Stars and Stripes from its headquarters in Washington DC to a military base 30 miles away has outraged staff members, who worry about losing their journalistic independence; concerns about the paper's independence have attracted the attention of members of Congress.
lead_paragraph: Editors and members of Congress fear that the cost-cutting action could lead to interference by the officials that Stars and Stripes reports on.

headline.seo: Stars and Stripes Staff Worried About Move to Military Base
headline.main: Moving Military Newspaper to Base Raises Concerns on Independence
headline.print_headline: Newspaper For the Troops Is Protesting New Quarters

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
